fields.summary: Exception on deliting Component

fields.description:
I get this when trying to create a new issue, doesn't matter whether it's a task (which has a custom field) or bug. Didn't see this in current release version trial

Create Issue
------------------------------------------------------------------------
[Ljava.lang.String;@71ad16

Step 2 of 2: Enter the details of the issue...
Form Errors: 
*	Exception: java.lang.NullPointerException
fields.summary: adding a new issue in Jira 2.0 early release

fields.description: As you may want to have more than one project mail listener (for multiple email addresses, or multiple mailing list combinations), it should not be set to unique.
fields.summary: ProjectMailListener is set to be unique

fields.description:
When trying to attach files we recieve the following error:

# Could not move attachment from /tmp/Jetty_0_0_0_0_8080__jira/horizon_850o9367.lasco to /jboss/jira/attachments/CCA/CCA-29/10008_horizon_850o.lasco

Have checked permissions in Jira - Create Attachments is set to jira-users, and attachments are enabled (0N).
Have checked file permissions in both directories - full write access is enabled, jboss is running as root.

The files are being created in /tmp correctly.
fields.summary: file attachment problem

fields.description: Project administrators should have the ability to define global filters that current/future users can use the same way that Preset Filters are there by default for everyone...
fields.summary: Defining of global Issue filters (like preset filters)

fields.description:
only jira-administrators can add component/version to a project, and they can do it to all projects.

as far as I understand, even a lead developer can not manage its project component or version list.

it would be better to have a project administrator level: other projects administrators should not be allowed to modify projects they do not administrate.
fields.summary: only jira-administrators can add component/version to a project

fields.description: All our data imports fine into the database, but there are no statuses (stati?) defined after the import.
fields.summary: Statuses are missing

fields.description:
I tried to create a new issue, but the "Assigned to" list was empty.  When I clicked to add the issue anyway I got a Form errors box at the top of the form with our old enemy 'NullPointerException' therein.

Bizarrely, under the create issue title is "[Ljava.lang.String;@b4aad2"!
fields.summary: Assignee not working when creating new issue

fields.description: As a consulting firm, we are using JIRA on various projects for various customers. Each project may have its own definition of priorites and resolutions which is different from other projects. We would like to be able to do this in JIRA too: Define priorities and resolutions on a per project basis.
fields.summary: Ability to define priorities and resolutions per project

fields.description:
The tab order on the login screen has changed.  I used to be able to enter my username <tab> password <tab> <space> to log in (as is standard on many systems).  Now it checks the box instead and I have to tab twice!

Sounds like a small thing but it is surprisingly irritating :)
fields.summary: Tab order on login screen harder to use

fields.description:
We work xp style with rotating pairs doing the work. Therefore we don't assign issues since most often everybody takes a crack at almost every issue. 

It would be really nice if you could turn of the assign feature per project.
fields.summary: Disabling assigning

fields.description:
We use Jira inside company and our customers uses same Jira too. Sometimes it will be great to create issue which will not be seen from 'outside'.

It think it can be simply solved by defining user group (to each issue) which can have access to issue.
fields.summary: Separate issue by permissions

fields.description:
For non-J2EE experts it easily becomes a nightmare if you always have to edit the entityengine.xml with a new version. Especially, if it's not fully correctly and some errors occur only after deploying.

Better: Provide an simple Swing-UI (invoked from ANT), that:
- lets you pick the old configuration file(s) and
- modify each parameter.
fields.summary: Simplify update procedure

fields.description:
Would like to see Issues displayed in the following manner:

1)  each issue represented as a collapsible folder (with the + or - icon in Windows folders)

2)  each response represented as a collapsible sub-folder (if there are more than 1 related sub-responses); otherwise, individual responses can be represented as a single thread icons

This allows an user to see which responses correspond to higher-level responses or issues. Such an UI would make Jira visually easier to navigate through all the responses/issues.
fields.summary: Add Tree Based Issue Tracking

fields.description:
I don't need to get an email for every change i make to my own issues.  It does make sense for others to be notified, though.

If not everybody agrees, this could be a configurable option.
fields.summary: Don't send email updates to the account used to make the update

fields.description:
when we restart the server, the attachments button disappears from the users screens until I go into the administration page, select on attachments, and click "activate"

then the next time I restart the server, I have to do this again.
fields.summary: have to manually turn attachments back on after restart

fields.description:
We need some kind of mechanism to allow partial text string searches.  For example, if I want to find any time the string "part" is used, it will currently find "part", "partial" or "partially".  When I try "part*", it finds the above, plus the word "particularly".  Neither option finds the word "impartial".  When I try "*part", I receive the following error:

An error occurred searching: com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchException 

The main request here is to improve the text searching capabilities.
fields.summary: Error with "search" mechanism

fields.description:
I am unable to locate the function that allows users to change their passwords.  As admin user I can view the users information but do not see how to change a password.

Hopefully this is not an admin function but can be done by the users themselves so they can customize their password.

Additionally what happens when the Reset Password function is selected.  There is no indication as to what it is reset to, so this function is unusable in its state.
fields.summary: Password change and reset functionality ?

fields.description:
We get the following error periodically (every 30sec or so - there must be some timer?)

As far as we can tell Jira seems to be working fine. We seem to be able to do everything we want (except delete users, it seems - but I think that is something else...)

-Nick Minutello

fields.description:
View Projects /jira/secure/admin/default.jsp

Lead Developer names with international characters are formed with wrong encoding. "View profile" prints the names correctly.
fields.summary: Incorrect international characters in 'View Projects'

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a group called "Test???"
2. Delete the group. 

The group is not deleted, but a new group called "Test????f?????????f?????" is created to database table jira.groupbase.

It seems that the url generated for the deletion is incorrect:
/jira/secure/admin/user/DeleteGroup!default.jspa?name=Testi????

Using group's id instead of the name might be an easy way around the special charset problems.
fields.summary: Cannot delete group with special characters
Ability to rename a saved filter
Delete user UI enhancement

fields.description:
I am using XDoclet.  I submitted a bug report to their project tracking that uses JIRA.  I wanted to edit the report, but I could not.

Is this a limitation of JIRA or the way they have it set-up?

Thanks,
fields.summary: Edit issues I submitted?
Make more use of time tracking features

fields.description:
Somewhere in JIRA, the category object is being used in a serializable object:


2002-11-08 15:00:34 StandardManager[/jira] IOException while loading persisted sessions: java.io.WriteAbortedException: writing aborted; 

java.io.NotSerializableException: org.apache.log4j.Category
java.io.WriteAbortedException: writing aborted; java.io.NotSerializableException:org.apache.log4j.Category
  at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject0(ObjectInputStream.java:1268)


In addition - the following Objects are being stored in the session which are not Serializable:
- WorkflowEntry
- SearchRequest
- SearchSort
fields.summary: Serializablilty of Objects in Session

fields.description: We need the issue key for preparing individual reports from the RSS feed. Yes I can extract the issue key from the link tag but having a separate key tag would be much more convenient.
fields.summary: key tag in the RSS 0.9.2 feed

fields.description: Instead of uploading a file as an attachment it would be nice if one could specify a URL as a lionk reference.
fields.summary: Link reference instead of uploading an attachement

fields.description:
Enahnce MailListener and let us configure it to send notifications to specific addresses. It's very common to send notification to a mailing list. I want to configure it to send emails to xdoclet-devel mailing list so that all developers (not just the reporter/assigne) be able to see it. RSS clients are a bit limited and not every developers uses one, so mail is more atractive. Btw, obviously user subscription and such should be configured separately from issue/change notifications.

Cheers,
Ara.
fields.summary: Enahnce MailListener and let us configure it to send notifications to specific addresses

fields.description: Give the admin some feedback if they do something stupid like type in the export directory but forget the name of the file to export to.  Currently the message that is displayed is very undescriptive.
fields.summary: Give Feedback About Exporting Errors

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to give some users the ability to add components to a specific project.

This "project" is not using jira as a software issue tracking system, but rather to track tasks for growing list of "data collections". We treat each collection as a component.
fields.summary: Non-admin Component Add Permission

fields.description:
After starting up the standalone (everytime), the first time my service gets called and executes the following code:

ActionResult result = 
ActionDispatcher.execute(ActionNames.ISSUE_CREATE, 
      UtilMisc.toMap("project", project, "remoteUser", reporter,
                     "fields", fields));

...two duplicate issues get created.  Anytime after that when my service runs, and that same code gets executed, it works perfectly fine.

The reason I say duplicate (implying not my fault), is because when I actually look in JIRA at the "newly added issues" filter, I see a list
that contains on issue twice.  The issue ID is the same for both.  For example, the project in which I discovered this bug has a key of "JEMS".  In the list I saw "JEMS-30" twice, which is really messed up.  

The other funky thing is that the "issue created" email listener only gets triggered once.  Also, when I delete one, I can't get into the other even though it still shows up in the list.  Also, when go into one and edit it, it only changes the data for the one.

For now I create a dummy project and on initilization of the service, I create a dummy issue for the dummy project.  But this is a terrible hack and really needs to be fixed.

Thanks,
Aaron
fields.summary: Duplicate Issues Created When Making an API Call

fields.description:
I would like to be able to define who does get eMail notifications on updates freely:

- I would like to add/remove the reporter of the issue
- I would like to add/remove the assignee of the issue
- I would like to add/remove the owner of the project for that issue
- I would like to add/remove the any other JIRA users to the project/issue
- I would like to add/remove the any other non-JIRA users to the project/issue
fields.summary: Configurable eMail notification

fields.description:
People seem to be somewhat confused about JIRA's terminology for various issue types. They are:

1) Bug
2) Improvement
3) Task
4) New Feature

My immediate understanding/translation of these terms are (in more traditional jargon):

1) Bug Report
2) Patch
3) Task
4) Feature Request

When I looked at the (?) for New Issue I realised my interpretation was "wrong". Then I realised that there is no JIRA equivalent for "patch", i.e. code contributions/fixes from strangers.

Personally I don't care how they are called, but it becomes a problem when people raising new issues constantly interpret the current terms differently. I have applied several patches that were logged as "New Feature". -And feature requests are often logged as "Improvement".

Some people _have_ an "Improvement", others _want_ one. Likewise, some people _have_ a "New Feature", others _want_ one. I think you get my point.

Most people won't bother to even look at the (?) to figure out what the different issue types mean. Would you consider changing the terms and possibly add a default issue type for "patch"?

Cheers,
Aslak - the XDoclet team.

a)
fields.summary: Terminology change for issues

fields.description: Is there a DTD or XML Schema file for the import XML, so that i can convert and import certain data from a legacy Defect Tracking software.
fields.summary: Is there a DTD or XML Schema file for the import XML

fields.description: JIRA throws a Content Length Error ( 2191697 > 2097152 ) when trying to add a large attachment file. Is there a way to set the maximum content length.
fields.summary: JIRA throws a Content Length Error ( 2191697 > 2097152 )

fields.description:
In 'Find Issues', if you select 'Full Content' view, it does not show the component properly, even though it has a place for the field on the page.

E.g.

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&pid=10240&sorter/order=ASC&sorter/field=priority&resolutionIds=-1&component=10125&view=full
fields.summary: 'Full Content' Issue List not showing component properly

fields.description: It would be usefull to make it possible to search by component
fields.summary: Searching components

fields.description:
Get the following error:

javax.servlet.ServletException: (class: org/apache/jsp/viewissue$jsp, method: _jspService signature: (Ljavax/servlet/http/HttpServletRequest;Ljavax/servlet/http/HttpServletResponse;)V) Illegal target of jump or branch
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:481)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)

from
fields.summary: Creating an issue with version none

fields.description: If one customizes their installation of JIRA (and we have), then the help ones receives from the yellow help baloons is now inappropriate. It goes back to the atlassian website. As an enhancement, it would be great to include in the distribution a 'docs' directory that contains everything that is available online at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/ This way, it could be customized for each install, and instead of confusing users with issue types and priorities that aren't there anymore (or are missing some!), we'd have appropriate values. Same goes for 'versions' and 'components'. Instead of describing generically what they are, we could list our actual components, and for the non-intuitive, describe why it's appropriate to log HTML bugs as type: bug, priority: trivial, and component: user-interface. Forward thinking.. it would be handy if these were JSP pages, so that the pages would update themselves. (it would pull the icon and description from the db, as the admin pages do currently). What we will probably end up doing is combing the pages for any
fields.summary: 'Get Online Help' icons not helpful in a customized install.

fields.description:
Administrators.jspa

It would be nice to use a javascript to obfusicate the email addresses on the adminstrators page.
fields.summary: Obscure email addresses on Administrators page

fields.description: If I create & save a custom filter, then I don't see any way to subsequently alter it except by deleting it and re-creating it.  It would be nice if the Manage Filters screen had an Edit option as well as the View & Delete ones; this could use a similar screen to the Create New action, pre-initialised with the saved definition but overwriting the existing filter when you Save it rather than prompting for a new name & description.
fields.summary: Edit saved filters
List summary of issues by type on the project browser

fields.description:
In the XDoclet JIRA we have the "Allow unassigned issues" option set ON.  However, new issues are still created with the Assigned To field set to the project lead by default.  It would be nice if they could default to Unassigned instead.

Even nicer still would be if you could configure a default Assignee on a per-project basis (only our main XDoclet project needs to default to Unassigned, for the other subprojects the lead is a suitable assignee).

Nicest of all would be if you could set a default Assignee on a per-component basis (again, possibly Unassigned).  We have a component for each of our modules; some modules are always maintained by the same developer so should be assigned to them by default, while others are maintained by a few people so should default to Unassigned).  With a bit of client-side JavaScript, it should even be possible to have the Assigned To value change appropriately as the Component is chosen from the drop down.
fields.summary: Smarter default for the Assigned To field

fields.description:
On a similar note to JRA-928, on the home page I'd find it useful if as well as the section for open issues "Assigned To Me" there was a section for issues "Raised By Me".

And, while I'm wishing, instead of the section for "In Progress" issues, which just wastes space repeating a subset of the "Assigned To Me" entries, couldn't it just have an extra column in the previous section to indicate which ones are & aren't in progress?  This would also be useful in the Raised By Me section mentioned above, so I can see which of my bugs are likely to be fixed first/soon.
fields.summary: List issues I raised on the home page

fields.description:
I noticed earlier this morning that the XDoclet JIRA had no project lead listed against the XDoclet (XDT) project.  On clicking the Administration link, however, the resulting projects list had the following in the lead developer column for that project:

ERROR: Developer andrew not found. Set lead to andrew. 
Andrew Stevens

I clicked through to the Details page, and sure enough the Lead Developer field had my login filled in.  I'm not too worried about the fact it had been blank (the other developers have been fiddling with that field to try and get the CVS change log stuff working), but the fact it suddenly started showing my login instead of the blank value, just because I'd viewed the admin pages, looks like a bug to me.
fields.summary: Project lead set to unexpected value

fields.description:
Whilst playing with permissions, I added the 'Jira Users' permission to the 'Anyone' group.  When I go to remove this group, it returns to the page with a red error bar down below.. stating "Group does not exist".
 
I notice that the 'Del' link beside each group on the permissions page (global one), is of the form:

GlobalPermissions.jspa?action=del&permType=x&groupName=y

Where x is the permission you're removing the group from and
where y is the name of the group you're removing from that permission.

The link for 'Anyone' under 'Jira Users', however is like this:

GlobalPermissions.jspa?action=del&permType=1&groupName=del
 
IF I use the address bar of the browser and replace 'del' with 'Anyone', I no longer get any error message, but the group is also not removed.
 
If I use my fake-out on another group, I can successfully remove it, so I'm fairly certain I've got the parameters correct.   
 
So how about it? What's the name of the 'Anyone' group?  It's not 'del' is it?
fields.summary: Cannot remove 'Anyone' group from a permission

fields.description:
accented letters are replaced by a '?' (eacute should appear between square brackets: [?])

as far as I undersand bug JRA-457 this problem should be closed, so what happens?...

thanks
-- 
Joseph
fields.summary: accented letters are replaced by a '?' (eacute should appear between square brackets: [?])

fields.description:
It would be great to be able to add notes to a release not just have the list of resolved issues.

For example:

This release continues our progress toward version 22. Most of the features planned for 22 are now available in beta form. This version has only been tested in linux.

-k.
fields.summary: Add ability to add notes to a release

fields.description: I was allowed to create a project with 2 character code i.e. ES but the Mailhandler code, JiraUtils.java checks for 3 or more.
fields.summary: Projectkey minimal 3 characters but 2 accepted

fields.description: To make th eregistration process easier, can we add an attachment on the initial issue creation page, rather then to 'wait' for the details page ?
fields.summary: Add attachements on initial Issue Create page

fields.description:
When there is 1 message in the mailbox I get the following exception:

2002-10-30 17:39:12,553 DEBUG [com.atlassian.jira.service.services.pop.PopService] There are 1 messages in the pop folder
2002-10-30 17:39:12,553 DEBUG [com.atlassian.jira.service.services.pop.PopService] Message Subject: jsmart/com/smart/jms - New directory
2002-10-30 17:39:12,554 ERROR [com.atlassian.jira.service.services.pop.PopService] Throwable: java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.pop.PopService.run(PopService.java:99)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainer.run(JiraServiceContainer.java:63)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runServices(ServiceRunner.java:52)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraTimerTask.run(JiraTimerTask.java:34)
        at java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:432)
        at java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:382)

The message I have in the mailbox is the following:


From alwyn@bigcruncher.smarties.com.ph Wed Oct 30 17:31:20 2002
Return-path: <alwyn@bigcruncher.smarties.com.ph>
Envelope-to: jira@smarties.com.ph
Received: from localhost
        ([127.0.0.1] helo=bigcruncher ident=alwyn)

To: jira@smarties.com.ph
Subject: jsmart/com/smart/jms - New directory
Message-Id: <E186pC4-0002sv-00@bigcruncher.smarties.com.ph>
Date: Wed, 30 Oct 2002 17:31:20 +0800

In directory bigcruncher.smarties.com.ph:/tmp/cvs-serv11089/jms

Log Message:
Directory /var/lib/cvs/jsmart/com/smart/jms added to the repository
fields.summary: NullPointerException using PopService and CVS

fields.description:
I've run JIRA under JBoss with at last count 2+ weeks of uptime.  
 
Just recently switched to Tomcat on the above platform, and over the weekend, something must have happened to the db connections?
 
Anything involving more than a read of the database (meaning, updating or deleting) now fails with the following generic error:
 
Exception: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following: SELECT ID, pname, URL, LEAD, DESCRIPTION, pkey, pcounter FROM project WHERE ID=? (Communication link failure: java.io.IOException)

Each error trace is slightly different. For example, sometimes there will be "ERROR [some webwork action]" in at the beginning of the trace. Other times it's absent, and you have to look inside the stack to see that you were trying to do com.atlassian.jira.action.issue.IssueCreate.doExecute()
 
Restarting Tomcat seems to have solved the problems.
 
Anyone else getting these connection troubles on Tomcat ?
fields.summary: Database Connection trouble with MySQL

fields.description: we've had several contractors leave lately and their userid's are in the system; I can't delete them because they're listed as the assignee on closed tasks. I can remove them from all groups, but they still show up in user listings even though they're not "active", and I can't erase the email address (which is no longer valid) from their account
fields.summary: need ability to 'disable' users without deleting

fields.description:
I would like to populate a new Jira installation with some content which I have exported from another demo installation. 

I got the following error message:

Form Errors: 
Exception occurred: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Character conversion error: "Malformed UTF-8 char -- is an XML encoding declaration missing?" (line number may be too low). 

As a work around: If you could provide us with some demo content (e.g. a snapshot of the Jira demosite) it would help 

Thanks

Wolfgang
fields.summary: character conversion error: Malformed UTF-8 char

fields.description: We would like on the 'Browse Project' 'Open Issues' page to add a list under the 'By Assignee' list called 'By Reporter'. This is so that a business user can quickly get to their issues.
fields.summary: Open Issues By Reporter

fields.description:
We need to be able to change the reporter field for an issue.

This is because people are entering issues on behalf of others, but we want to filter issues based on the intended reporter rather than the actual reporter. The easiest way of doing this would be to edit the reporter field.
fields.summary: Amend Reporter

Hi

If so How,


Thanks
Madhu

fields.description:
It would be very nice to be able to search for all unscheduled items across multiple projects.  We are running about a dozen projects using JIRA, and I would like to keep my finger on the pulse of new feature requests & recent (unscheduled) bug reports.  

Thanks!

Jack

fields.description:
I've been running 1.3.2 for a while, and when I tried a 1.4.3 install, I'm having all kinds of problems that basically makes it not usabled (I can't run previous to 1.4.3 due to import/export problems).

1. Looses attachement path, I specify it during set, and then immediately go to the jira configuration screen and then click on Edit Configuration, the attachement path field is blank and the allow attachements radio buttons are blank - neither on or off are checked (yes the attachment directory already exists).

2. I then check to turn attachments on, and press update and get the following NPE:

  java.lang.NullPointerException
	at sun.io.Converters.getConverterClass(Converters.java:78)
	at sun.io.Converters.newConverter(Converters.java:138)
	at sun.io.ByteToCharConverter.getConverter(ByteToCharConverter.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.EditApplicationProperties.doValidation(EditApplicationProperties.java:111)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.validate(ActionSupport.java:331)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:107)
	at webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher.service(ServletDispatcher.java:261)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:336)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._ie.doFilter(.:59)
	at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.parsePage(Unknown Source)
	at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.doFilter(Unknown Source)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._ic.doFilter(.:16)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.security.SecurityFilter.doFilter(SecurityFilter.java:202)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._ic.doFilter(.:20)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.security.LoginFilter.doFilter(LoginFilter.java:196)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._ic.doFilter(.:20)
	at com.atlassian.util.filters.ProfilingFilter.doFilter(Unknown Source)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._ic.doFilter(.:20)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.EncodingFilter.doFilter(EncodingFilter.java:29)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._deb._lnc(.:376)

3. Skipping past that problem, if I then import my old data and try to start using the system, Go to New Issue, and there is nothing in the Issue Type: field, so I can't create new issues, 

If I try to resolve an existing issue, I can't as there are no Resolution types selected as well.


4. There seem to be multiple problems with style-sheets (as in they are not being read correctly.  If I look at the source of any of the pages, I see a CSS import like this:

      <link rel="stylesheet" href="/jira/styles/global.css">

But, when I snoop around the atlassian-jira-web directory, it looks like it should be global.css.jsp

I noticed this because many of the fonts/colors are all off or different from my 1.3 installation.
fields.summary: Various setup problems with 1.4.3

What I'm looking for is probably some configuration of which columns to view/hide in the Issue Navigator - otherwise it might get to wide for the screen to display properly.

fields.description:
Hi,

On your own Jira installation, when I view my user profile or reported issues etc. my name reads properly: "Mikael J?rgensen" - however, in the top bar of the Jira window, the user reads "User: Mikael J?nsen" ???

fields.description:
We have begun using the roadmap actively and it is very good at showing how various bugs and tasks etc. are targetted towards releases etc.
However, for clarity it would be nice to add filtering to the roadmap, e.g. being able to show the roadmap for a selected component of the chosen project.
Right now, as far as I can see, there is no way I can get a list of issues that includes the versions they are targeted against - if I use the Issue Navigator the list view does not include the target version and if I use the Full Content I loose the overview.
fields.summary: Filtering on roadmap

fields.description: Most of the time, when I perform a search (filter), the results are way out of proportion, because the page footer gets put into one of the cells of the results table.  This also makes the calculations of the number of issues be off somehow.

fields.description: When I click on Change Log, selecting either next 3 versions or all versions, it is only showing the issues for the latest released version and nothing else.  On the Road Map, it's only showing the release just before that.

When I press the delete button, nothing seems to happen.  I tried this a second time after creating another new user and the same problem occurs.
fields.summary: Delete User does not work

fields.description: When selecting the excel view, only the displayed issues get downloaded (at most 20). According to the documentation ALL issues are supposed to be downloaded (I agree with the documentation on what the expected behaviour should be in this regard).
fields.summary: Excel view shows only current page of issues

fields.description: I have installed the new version 1.4.2 of Jira. We were using 1.3.3 before. When I logged into the new version I wondered why the look&feel was somewhat strange. I found out the the file global.css was missing. Instead I found a file called global.css.jsp. I copied globals.css.jsp to global.css and everything was fine.
fields.summary: global.css was missing

fields.description: The text "Remove component from all issues" does not imply that all issues assigned to this component will be deleted as well. In fact one of our uses thought that this operation will assign the issues to the component "No component". Perhaps it would be a good idea to tell the user that this operation deletes the issues as well.
fields.summary: Deleting a component deletes all issues as well

fields.description:
Issue Navigator, Full Content View: 
Instead of the component of an issue "none" is displayed.
fields.summary: Component=none in Full Content view

fields.description: Create a new column titled "Closing Date" to allow the accurate recording of essential operations.
fields.summary: New column

fields.description:
We've been using Jira for a while and generally find it the Mutt's nuts.  One thing which has never quite seemed right though is the assignment of priorities to Tasks, Improvements and New Features. We think it's because the priorities in Jira are really severities of bugs and not priorities at all.  It would be great to be able to assign priorities to issues that really do relate to the amount of time that should be spent on them.

For example, if there is some corner case whereby a very specific set of actions can cause the system crash, the severity of the bug is indeed 'Blocker'.  However, it may be that no-one in their right mind would ever do such an odd thing and that it is more important to the clients that we fix more pressing things, which may be 'Minor' or even 'Trivial' severity such as a typo on the main page.

In the same vein, none of the available priorities really seem appropriate to requests for improvements such as this one.

So my suggestion is to have a set of Priorities from 'Urgent' to 'Yeah, whenever' and maybe assign the existing 'Severities' to bugs only.  How on Earth to retro-fit that into existing databases would then no doubt be cause for discussion!

What do you reckon?

  Mike
fields.summary: A Jira 'Priority' is really 'Severity' - could we specify a Severity and a Priority instead?
Find Issues:  Poject field value

fields.description: If I comment a file attachment, non-english characters are not properly stored. Comments with other actions, descriptions, user names etc. work OK.
fields.summary: i18l: comment for an attachment

fields.description:
Bank-Verlag wants to use JIRA for Bug Reporting. Our Clients are German Banks. Bug Descriptions are usually written in German. In JIRA it is impossible to save descriptions (or summaries, components etc.) where special alphabetic characters from the german alphabet are used.
i.e.
ISO-8859-1 Chr. 196, 214, 220, 223, 228, 246, 252

The consequence: the text is cut where one of those very commonly used german characters are used
fields.summary: Missing alphabetic characters cause incomplete information

fields.description:
I have set up a filter showing me all open issues across All Projects (nice feature though!).
When I access the filter it correctly does not refer to a project name.
If I view one of the issues, press Back and refresh, the top text in the Issue Navigator now refers to a project name:
"Displaying issues 1 to 17 of 17 matching issues in project XXXX" 

If I now go back to HOME and re-apply the filter, it keeps refering to the project even though the issuelist correctly include issues from all projects.
fields.summary: Display of project name in filter viewing All Projects

fields.description:
Currently, when you log work on a bug, it automatically changes the estimate to tell you how much work is left. This is good.

However, JIRA should also preserve the original estimate in a separate place. This will eventually allow you to compare the original estimate with the  time actually spent, letting you know whether your estimates are high, or low, or on target. This is a particularly necessary in XP development.
fields.summary: Jira should preserve original work estimate

fields.description:
Currently the hmtl has the style on the table headers set to style="cursor: hand". This isn't actually a valid css name and mozilla will not honour it.

There's a nice hack at http://www.fo3nix.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk/tutorials/css/hacks.htm that shows how to make mouseovers work in both mozilla and IE 5/5.5/6.

As the priority says, this is a trivial issue, but it's the small things that add up ;)
fields.summary: Make MouseOvers on the table header change the cursor to a hand in Mozilla

fields.description:
The link page requires you to enter the ID of another issue. If you don't know the exact ID, you have to either back out of the link screen and go search for it, or open up another browser window and do the search from there.

The link page has a lot of blank space in it, and it would seem reasonable to add some sort of search and/or issue browser to that page to streamline the process.
fields.summary: Add search capability to "Link Existing ..." page
